snippet: As budgets are pinched and business falters, public museums and companies across Europe are seeking to make ends meet by auctioning off artworks.
abstract: Museums across Europe are considering selling off art works to take advantage of record prices and to make up for cuts in government subsidies to public institutions; practice was long looked down upon in art world, but museums in United States have also considered the option, leading to worries from some quarters that trend will lead to masterpieces disappearing from public view.
lead_paragraph: As budgets are pinched and business falters, public museums and companies across Europe are seeking to make ends meet by auctioning off artworks.

headline.main: Seeing a Cash Cow in Museums’ Precious Art
headline.print_headline: Seeing a Cash Cow in Museums’ Precious Art
